docs.lead_paragraph: Many doctors love the work they do caring for patients and their families. But increasingly, practicing physicians are becoming frustrated with the constraints of a medical system that doesn't always let them do their jobs the way they want to, writes Dr. Pauline Chen in today's Doctor and Patient column.

headline.main: Why Some Doctors Don't Like Their Jobs

docs.abstract: Getting reimbursed is becoming increasingly burdensome for doctors; no wonder so many doctors are unhappy, Dr. Pauline Chen reports in today's Doctor and Patient column.
docs.snippet: Getting reimbursed is becoming increasingly burdensome for doctors; no wonder so many doctors are unhappy, Dr. Pauline Chen reports in today's Doctor and Patient column.

headline.main: Will Inmates Be Allowed to Use the Exchanges? Immigrants?

docs.abstract: Illegal immigrants and prison inmates are expressly prohibited from purchasing insurance through the national exchanges. But legal immigrants will be permitted to use the exchanges and to receive subsidies, and to qualify for Medicaid.
docs.snippet: Illegal immigrants and prison inmates are expressly prohibited from purchasing insurance through the national exchanges. But legal immigrants will be permitted to use the exchanges and to receive subsidies, and to qualify for Medicaid.

docs.abstract: Part 1 of our deep dive into the details of the Class Act, the federal government's new long-term care insurance program.
docs.snippet: Part 1 of our deep dive into the details of the Class Act, the federal government's new long-term care insurance program.

docs.lead_paragraph: With Gov. Charlie Crist’s break from the Republican Party, Florida politics becomes gawk-worthy again.

headline.seo: Crist Announces Independent Bid for Senate

docs.snippet: With Gov. Charlie Crist’s break from the Republican Party, Florida politics becomes gawk-worthy again.

docs.lead_paragraph: Paul Volcker, an informal adviser to President Obama, said that while he still supported the consumption tax, it was too politically unpopular to be used for deficit reduction.

headline.seo: Volcker Rules Out a Value-Added Tax for Now
headline.main: Former Fed Chief Dampens Talk of a Tax
headline.print_headline: Former Fed Chief Dampens Talk of a Tax

docs.snippet: Paul Volcker, an informal adviser to President Obama, said that while he still supported the consumption tax, it was too politically unpopular to be used for deficit reduction.

docs.lead_paragraph: A report shows that family doctors, paid by the visit, perform many hours of uncompensated follow-up work.

headline.seo: Study Details the ‘Invisible’ Work Burden of Family Doctors
headline.main: Study Shows ‘Invisible’ Burden of Family Doctors
headline.print_headline: Study Shows Extent Of ‘Invisible Work’ By Family Doctors

docs.snippet: A report shows that family doctors, paid by the visit, perform many hours of uncompensated follow-up work.
